div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1856 Shaikhano Dheri, near Charsadda (anc. Peucolaotis), Gandhara, Pakistan, 1940 Burial: 1st cent. B.C. (Le Rider) Contents: 130+ AR Menander: 9 tetradr.; 6 dr. Strato I and Agathocleia: 2 tetradr. Heliocles II?: 1 dr. Archebius?: 2 dr. Antimachus II: 2 dr. Philoxenus: 16 tetradr.; 9 dr. (square) Antialcidas: 7 dr. Diomedes: 5 tetradr.; 2 dr. Amyntas: 2 dr. Hermaeus: 10 tetradr.; 8 dr. Hermaeus and Calliope: 1 tetradr.; 1 dr. Disposition: Sotheby, April 30, 1958 (Haughton), nos. 335, 352, 393, 399, 404, 423, 457-8, 477 or 478, 480, 483-5, 494-5, 499-502 Haughton, NC 1940, pp. 123-6 Shortt, NC 1963, pp. 13-5 A square copper coin of Philoxenus may have come from the hd. A tetradr. of Amyntas included by Haughton has later been shown to be a forgery
